Class AbstractRssReader<C extends Channel, I extends Item>

java.lang.Object
com.apptasticsoftware.rssreader.AbstractRssReader<C,I>
Direct Known Subclasses:
FeedReader, ItunesFeedReader, MediaRssReader, OpenSearchFeedReader, PodcastFeedReader, PscFeedReader, RssReader, SpotifyFeedReader, YoutubeFeedReader
public abstract class AbstractRssReader<C extends Channel, I extends Item> extends Object
Abstract base class for implementing modules or extensions of RSS / Atom feeds with custom tags and attributes.

    • setUserAgent

      public AbstractRssReader<C,I> setUserAgent(String userAgent)
      Sets the user-agent of the http client. Optional parameter if not set the default value for java.net.http.HttpClient will be used.
      Parameters:
      userAgent - the user-agent to use.
      Returns:
      updated RSSReader.

    • addHeader

      public AbstractRssReader<C,I> addHeader(String key, String value)
      Adds an http header to the http client.
      Parameters:
      key - the key name of the header.
      value - the value of the header.
      Returns:
      updated RSSReader.

    • setConnectionTimeout

      public AbstractRssReader<C,I> setConnectionTimeout(Duration connectionTimeout)
      Sets the connection timeout for the http client. The connection timeout is the time it takes to establish a connection to the server. If set to zero the default value for HttpClient.Builder.connectTimeout(Duration) will be used. Default: 25 seconds.
      Parameters:
      connectionTimeout - the timeout duration.
      Returns:
      updated RSSReader.

    • setRequestTimeout

      public AbstractRssReader<C,I> setRequestTimeout(Duration requestTimeout)
      Sets the request timeout for the http client. The request timeout is the time between the request is sent and the first byte of the response is received. If set to zero the default value for HttpRequest.Builder.timeout(Duration) will be used. Default: 25 seconds.
      Parameters:
      requestTimeout - the timeout duration.
      Returns:
      updated RSSReader.

    • setReadTimeout

      public AbstractRssReader<C,I> setReadTimeout(Duration readTimeout)
      Sets the read timeout. The read timeout it the time for reading all data in the response body. The effect of setting the timeout to zero is the same as setting an infinite Duration, ie. block forever. Default: 25 seconds.
      Parameters:
      readTimeout - the timeout duration.
      Returns:
      updated RSSReader.
